body.head: NEE023315
body.p: A man and his father-in-law were out hunting together. It started to rain so they sat down underneath a huge tanòi tree to wait for the rain to pass. The father-in-law sat right up against the tree, his son-in-law further away. It was raining at the same time as the sun was shiningHumans must take great care at such times since it indicates the presence of bas (who otherwise move only at night). (saben tiregen). After a while the rain subsided. The man called to his father-in-law, "It is raining less now." There was no reply. A bit later he called out, "The rain is stopping." As there was still no answer, he walked up to the tanoi treeThe tanòi tree is one of the largest trees in the Malay forest, and it is a traditional home for bas. For the man to sit close to a tanòi tree during saben tiregen was therefore to expose himself to extreme danger. to see what his father-in-law was doing. His father-in-law had become a bas. Long hairs were covering his body, and he moved towards his son-in-law wanting to eat his ruwai. The man ran away as fast as he could.
